Summary: The proposal focuses on integrating deep learning with Bayesian methods to enhance probabilistic inference, targeting neural variational inference, hybrid inference schemes, and uncertainty quantification. It presents a structured approach with a clear problem statement and detailed experiment plan.
Strengths: Structured approach addressing specific challenges in three distinct parts.
Weaknesses: Incremental novelty, lacking a paradigm-shifting contribution.
Insufficient discussion of technical challenges and risks.
Limited focus on real-world validation beyond standard benchmarks.
Questions: What are the computational overheads of the proposed hybrid methods?
How will convergence guarantees for neural variational families be ensured?
What real-world scenarios will be used for validation beyond standard benchmarks?
Limitations: Potential high computational cost of hybrid methods.
Uncertainty about convergence guarantees for neural variational families.
Limited discussion on scalability to very large models.
